sen.j: 山名 宗全/山名 持豊（やまな そうぜん/やまな もちとよ、応永11年5月29日 (旧暦)（1404年7月6日） - 文明 (日本)5年3月18日 (旧暦)（1473年4月15日））は、室町時代の守護大名。
sen.e: Sozen YAMANA/Mochitoyo YAMANA (July 6th 1404-April 15th 1473; May 29th 1404-March 18th 1473 in lunar calender) was Shugo (Military Govenor) Daimyo in the Muromachi period.
Sozen YAMANA/Mochitoyo YAMANA (July 6th 1404-April 15th 1473; May 29th 1404-March 18th 1473 in lunar calender) was a Shugo (Military Govenor) Daimyo in the Muromachi period.
Sozen YAMANA (also known as Mochitoyo YAMANA) (July 6, 1404-April 15, 1473) was a Shugo (Military Governor) Daimyo in the Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: also known as補足; May 29th 1404-March 18th 1473 in lunar calender削除スペル

sen.j: 室町幕府の四職のひとつ山名氏の出身。
sen.e: He was from the Yamana family, one of the four families who monopolized shoshi-ship, the head of Samuraidokoro, the Office of Samurai.
He was from the Yamana family, one of the four Clans who monopolized the position of head of the Samuraidokoro, (the Board of Retainers).
sen.cmt: "family"→"Clan""shoshi-ship, the head of Samuraidokoro, the Office of Samurai"→"the position of head of the Samuraidokoro, (the Board of Retainers)"
sen.e: He was from the Yamana family, one of the four Clans who monopolized the position of head of the Samuraidokoro (the Board of Retainers).

sen.j: 山名家は新田氏族。
sen.e: The Yamana family belonged to the Nitta clan.
The Yamana family was a branch of the Nitta Clan.
sen.cmt: "belonged to the Nitta clan"→"was a branch of the Nitta Clan"
sen.e: The Yamana family was a branch of the Nitta clan.

sen.j: 山名時熙の三男で、母は山名師義の娘。
sen.e: He was the 3rd son of Tokihiro YAMANA and his mother was a daughter of Moroyoshi YAMANA.
He was the 3rd son of Tokihiro YAMANA and his mother was a daughter of Moroyoshi YAMANA.
He was the third son of Tokihiro YAMANA and his mother was a daughter of Moroyoshi YAMANA.

sen.j: 子に山名教豊、山名是豊、山名勝豊、山名政豊、山名時豊、細川勝元室、斯波義廉室、六角高頼室。
sen.e: His children were: Noritoyo YAMANA, Koretoyo YAMANA, Katsutoyo YAMANA, Masatoyo YAMANA, Tokitoyo YAMANA, Katsumoto HOSOKAWA's Lady, Yoshikado SHIBA's Lady, and Takayori ROKKAKU's Lady.

His sons were Noritoyo YAMANA, Koretoyo YAMANA, Katsutoyo YAMANA, Masatoyo YAMANA, and Tokitoyo YAMANA, and his daughters became the wives of Katsumoto HOSOKAWA, Yoshikado SHIBA, and Takayori ROKKAKU.
sen.cmt: "children"→"sons"Deleted colonAdded "and"Added "and his daughters became the wives of"Deleted "'s Lady"
sen.e: His sons were Noritoyo YAMANA, Koretoyo YAMANA, Katsutoyo YAMANA, Masatoyo YAMANA, and Tokitoyo YAMANA, and his daughters became the wives of Katsumoto HOSOKAWA, Yoshikado SHIBA, and Takayori ROKKAKU.

sen.j: 諱は持豊で、宗全は出家名。
sen.e: His real name was Mochitoyo, and Sozen was the name after becoming priest.
His real name was Mochitoyo, and he took the name Sozen after becoming a monk.
sen.cmt: "Sozen was the name after becoming priest"→"and he took the name Sozen after becoming a monk"
sen.e: His real name was Mochitoyo, and he took the name Sozen after becoming a monk.

sen.j: 通称は小次郎（こじろう）。
sen.e: His popular name was Kojiro.
His popular name was Kojiro.
His popular name was Kojiro.

sen.j: 1432年に家督を相続。
sen.e: He inherited the reigns of the family in 1432.
He inherited the reigns of the family in 1432.
He inherited the reigns of the family in 1432.

sen.j: 1435年には父の時熙が死去し、1437年には兄弟の山名持熙が持豊の家督相続に不満を持ち備後で挙兵し、これを鎮圧する。
sen.e: In 1435 his father Tokihiro Yamana passed away, and in 1437 his brother Mochihiro Yamana started a war in Bingo, dissatisfied with the inheritance of reigns of the family by Mochitoyo, brought this war under control.
In 1435 his father Tokihiro Yamana died and in 1437 he was defeated in an uprising in Bingo by his brother, Mochihiro Yamana, who was unhappy that Mochitoyo had inherited the family headship.
In 1435 his father Tokihiro died and in 1437 he was defeated in an uprising in Bingo by his brother, Mochihiro YAMANA, who was unhappy that Mochitoyo had inherited the family headship.

sen.j: 1440年には侍所頭人となる。
sen.e: In 1440 he became Samurai-dokoro Tonin, Governor of Samuraidokoro, the Office of Samurai.
In 1440 he became the Samurai-dokoro Tonin, Head of the Board of Retainers.
sen.cmt: "Governor of Samuraidokoro, the Office of Samurai"→"Head of the Board of Retainers"
sen.e: In 1440 he became the Samurai-dokoro Tonin, Head of the Board of Retainers.

sen.j: 1441年(嘉吉元)に赤松満祐らが6代将軍足利義教を殺害し、領国の播磨国で挙兵した嘉吉の乱では義教と同席していたが抵抗せずに脱出し、討伐軍の主力を率いて戦い鎮圧に貢献し、赤松氏の領国を加えて播磨国など8ヶ国の守護職を回復して再び権勢を得た。
sen.e: Although he was with Yoshinori, he fled without resistance during the Kakitsu Incident in 1441 when Mitsusuke AKAMATSU killed the sixth Shogun Yoshinori ASHIKAGA and started a war in the Province of Harima, he then contributed to suppress Mitsusuke by leading the punitive forces, and as result regained his power by being restored to position of Shugo over eighth provinces, adding the Akamatsu's familiy's Province of Harima.

Although he had sided with the sixth Shogun, Yoshinori ASHIKAGA, he fled without resistance during the Kakitsu Incident in 1441 when Mitsusuke AKAMATSU assassinated Yoshinori and started a war in the Province of Harima, nevertheless, he then led the main punitive force, defeating Mitsusuke and gaining the Akamatsu's domains, including Harima, to become the Shugo of eight provinces.
sen.cmt: Reworded sentence but the Japanese is badly written and not easy to understand
sen.e: Although he had sided with the sixth Shogun, Yoshinori ASHIKAGA, he fled without resistance during the Kakitsu Incident in 1441 when Mitsusuke AKAMATSU assassinated Yoshinori and started a war in the Province of Harima, nevertheless, he then led the main punitive force, defeating Mitsusuke and gaining the Akamatsu's domains, including Harima, to become the Shugo of eight provinces.

sen.j: 1443年には山名熙貴の娘を猶子に迎え、大内教弘に嫁がせ、1447年には同じく熙貴の娘を幕府管領の細川勝元に嫁がせて、大内氏や細川氏と縁戚関係を結ぶ。
sen.e: In 1443 he received Hirotaka YAMANA's daughter as his own child, and wed her to Norihiro Ouchi, and wed another daughter of the same Hirotaka to Katsumoto HOSOKAWA, a kanrei (shogunal deputy), creating a bond between the Ouchi family and the Hosokawa familiy.

In 1443 he adopted Hirotaka YAMANA's daughter and had her marry Norihiro Ouchi, and had another of Hirotaka's daughters marry Katsumoto HOSOKAWA, the Kanrei (shogunal deputy), creating a bond between his family and the Ouchi and Hosokawa Clans.
sen.cmt: "received"→"adopted"Deleted "as his own child""wed her to"→"had her marry""wed another daughter of the same Hirotaka"→"had another of Hirotaka's daughters marry""a"→"the"Added "his family""Ouchi family and the Hosokawa familiy"→"the Ouchi and Hosokawa Clans"
sen.e: In 1443 he adopted Hirotaka YAMANA's daughter and had her marry Norihiro OUCHI, and had another of Hirotaka's daughters marry Katsumoto HOSOKAWA in 1447, the Kanrei (shogunal deputy), creating a bond between his family and the Ouchi and Hosokawa clans.
sen.cmt: 全角削除人名修正年号補足用語統一

sen.j: 1450年(宝徳2)に出家し、家督を子の教豊に譲る。
sen.e: In 1450 he became a buddhist monk and left the reigns of the family to his son Noritoyo.
In 1450 he became a buddhist monk and handed over the reigns of the family to his son Noritoyo.
In 1450 he became a buddhist monk and handed over the reigns of the family to his son Noritoyo.

sen.j: 1454年には赤松氏の出仕を巡り8代将軍足利義政と対立し、政務を引退して但馬へ下国。
sen.e: In 1454 he had a dispute with the eighth Shogun Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA over the position of the Akamatsu family and resigned from governmental affairs taking up residence in Tajima.
In 1454 he had a dispute with the eighth Shogun, Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA, over the position of the Akamatsu family and resigned from governmental affairs, taking up residence in Tajima.
In 1454 he had a dispute with the eighth Shogun, Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA, over the position of the Akamatsu family and resigned from governmental affairs, taking up residence in Tajima.

sen.j: 赤松則尚が播磨で宗全の孫に当たる山名政豊を攻めると、但馬から出兵してこれを駆逐する。
sen.e: When Norihiro AKAMATSU attacked Sozen's grandchild Masatoyo YAMANA in Harima, he left with his forces from Tajima to expel Norihiro.
When Norihiro AKAMATSU attacked Sozen's grandchild, Masatoyo YAMANA, in Harima, he left with his forces from Tajima to expel Norihiro.
When Norihiro AKAMATSU attacked Sozen's grandchild, Masatoyo YAMANA, in Harima, he left with his forces from Tajima to expel Norihiro.

sen.j: 1458年には赦免されて再び上洛。
sen.e: In 1458 he was pardoned and returned to Kyoto.
In 1458 he was pardoned and returned to Kyoto.
In 1458 he was pardoned and returned to Kyoto.

sen.j: 幕政を巡り、娘婿である勝元と対立するようになる。
sen.e: He had a disagreement with this son-in-law Katsumoto over Shogunal politics.
He had a disagreement with his son-in-law, Katsumoto, over Shogunal politics.
He had a disagreement with his son-in-law, Katsumoto, over Shogunal politics.

sen.j: 三管領の畠山氏の家督争いでは、勝元は畠山政長を支持するのに対して畠山義就を支持、斯波氏の家督争いでは、斯波義敏を支持する勝元に対し斯波義廉を支持した。
sen.e: In the dispute over who to take over the reigns of the Hatakeyama family, kanrei of three provinces, Katsumoto was supporting Masanaga HATAKEYAMA, while Sozen was supporting Yoshinari HATAKEYAMAand in the struggle over the reigns of the Shiba family Katsumoto supported Yoshitoshi SHIBA, while he supported Yoshikado SHIBA.

In the dispute over who would take over the reigns of the Hatakeyama Clan, one of the three Kanrei families, Katsumoto supported Masanaga HATAKEYAMA, while Sozen supported Yoshinari HATAKEYAMAand in the struggle over the reigns of the Shiba Clan, Katsumoto supported Yoshitoshi SHIBA, while Sozen supported Yoshikado SHIBA.
sen.cmt: "to take"→"would""family"→"Clan""kanrei of three provinces"→"one of the three Kanrei families""was supporting"→"supported""family"→"Clan"Added comma"he"→"Sozen"
sen.e: In the dispute over who would take over the reigns of the Hatakeyama clan, one of the three Kanrei families, Katsumoto supported Masanaga HATAKEYAMA, while Sozen supported Yoshinari HATAKEYAMAand in the struggle over the reigns of the Shiba clan, Katsumoto supported Yoshitoshi SHIBA, while Sozen supported Yoshikado SHIBA.

sen.j: 1465年に男子を出産した足利義政正室の日野富子は、実子の足利義尚の将軍職を望み宗全に接近する。
sen.e: In 1465, the official wife of Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA, Tomiko HINO, who had given birth to a son, approached Sozen, because she wanted her own son Yoshihisa ASHIKAGA to become Shogun.
In 1465, Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA's wife, Tomiko HINO, gave birth to a son and, wanting him to become Shogun, approached Sozen.
sen.cmt: "the official wife of"→"wife" and moved"who had given birth"→"gave birth""because she wanted her own son Yoshihisa ASHIKAGA to become Shogun"→"and, wanting him to become Shogun," and moved
sen.e: In 1465, Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA's wife, Tomiko HINO, gave birth to a son and, wanting him to become Shogun, approached Sozen.

sen.j: 1466年には勝元と共謀して、政所執事の伊勢貞親や季瓊真蘂らを失脚させる文正の政変を行う。
sen.e: In 1466, he conspired with Katsumoto to remove Sadachika ISE, the Majordome of Madokoro, and Shinzui Kikei, in an incident called the Bunsho political change (Bunsho no seihen),
In 1466, he conspired with Katsumoto to remove Sadachika ISE, the head of the Mandokoro, and Shinzui Kikei, in an incident called the Bunsho Coup (Bunsho no seihen).
In 1466, he conspired with Katsumoto to remove Sadachika ISE, the head of the Mandokoro, and Shinzui Kikei, in an incident called the Bunsho Coup.

sen.j: 同年12月には畠山義就を上洛させ、将軍と対面させる。
sen.e: In December of the same year he forced Yoshinari Hatakeyama to go to Kyoto and meet the Shogun.
In December of the same year he forced Yoshinari HATAKEYAMA to go to Kyoto and meet the Shogun.
In December of the same year he forced Yoshinari HATAKEYAMA to go to Kyoto and meet the Shogun.

sen.j: 1467年には畠山政長が失脚して、管領は山名派の斯波義廉となる。
sen.e: In 1467 Masanaga HATAKEYAMA lost his position and Yamane's ally Yoshikado SHIBA became kanrei..
In 1467 Masanaga HATAKEYAMA was replaced as Kanrei by Yamane's ally, Yoshikado SHIBA.
sen.cmt: "lost his position and"→"was replaced as Kanrei by"Added commaDeleted "became kanrei."
sen.e: In 1467 Masanaga HATAKEYAMA was replaced as Kanrei by Yamana's ally, Yoshikado SHIBA.

sen.j: さらに上御霊社の戦いでは義就を加勢し、政長を駆逐させる。
sen.e: Moreover, in the battle at Kami-Mitama shrine, he joined the forces of Yoshinari and drove out Masanaga.
Moreover, in the battle at Kami-Goryo-sha shrine, he joined forces with Yoshinari to defeat Masanaga.
sen.cmt: "Kami-Mitama"→"Kami-Goryo-sha""the forces of"→"forces with""and drove out"→"to defeat"
sen.e: Moreover, in the battle at Kami-Goryo-sha Shrine, he joined forces with Yoshinari to defeat Masanaga.

sen.j: 5月には宗全と対立する赤松政則が播磨へ侵攻したのをはじめ、双方で散発的な衝突が起こる。
sen.e: Starting with an invasion of the province of Harima by Masanori AKAMATSU, who was opposing Sozen, in May, there were occasional confrontations between the two.
Starting with an invasion of the province of Harima by Masanori AKAMATSU, an enemy of Sozen, in May, there were occasional confrontations between the two.
Starting with an invasion of the province of Harima by Masanori AKAMATSU, an enemy of Sozen, in May, there were occasional confrontations between the two.

sen.j: 宗全は出石・此隅山城に各国から集結した西軍を率いて挙兵し、京都へ進軍する（応仁の乱）。
sen.e: Sozen raised and took command of the Western Forces, which had assembled at the Izushi and Konokuma-yama castles from various provinces, and marched onto Kyoto (Onin War).
Sozen raised and took command of the Western Forces, which had assembled at the Izushi and Konokuma-yama castles from various provinces, and marched to Kyoto (Onin War).
Sozen raised and took command of the Western Forces, which had assembled at the Izushi and Konokumayama-jo castles from various provinces, and marched to Kyoto (Onin War).

sen.j: 当初室町亭の将軍らを確保した勝元率いる東軍に対して劣勢であったが、8月には周防から上洛した大内政弘と合流し、一進一退の状況になる。
sen.e: At first he was in an inferior position to the Eastern Forces led by Katsumoto, who had taken control of the Shogun at Muromachi manor, but in August he joined forces with Masahiro OUCHI, who had come to Kyoto from Suo, and the situation became more balanced.

At first he was in an inferior position to the Eastern Forces led by Katsumoto, who had taken control of the Shogun at Muromachi manor, but in August he joined forces with Masahiro OUCHI, who had come to Kyoto from Suo, and the situation became more balanced.

At first he was in an inferior position to the Eastern Forces led by Katsumoto, who had taken control of the Shogun at Muromachi manor, but in August he joined forces with Masahiro OUCHI, who had come to Kyoto from Suo, and the situation became more balanced.

sen.j: 1472年には和平交渉も行われたが、赤松政則の抵抗などで失敗、5月には宗全は自害を試みている。
sen.e: In 1472 there were truce negotiations, but they failed due to the protests of Masanori AKAMATSU, and in May Sozen tried to commit suicide.
In 1472 there were truce negotiations, but they failed due to the protests of Masanori AKAMATSU, and in May Sozen tried to commit suicide.
In 1472 there were truce negotiations, but they failed due to the protests of Masanori AKAMATSU, and in May Sozen tried to commit suicide.

sen.j: 1473年(文明5)に病死、享年69。
sen.e: In 1473 he died of a disease, aged 69.
In 1473 he died of disease, aged 69.
In 1473 he died of disease, aged 69.

sen.j: 法名：達碧院殿最高宗峰大居士。
sen.e: His posthumous Buddhist name is:
sen.cmt: 法名の正確な読み方が不明です。
sen.e: His posthumous Buddhist name is:
His posthumous Buddhist name is: 達碧院殿最高宗峰大居士
sen.cmt: 法名の正確な読み方が不明です。

sen.j: 墓所は京都市左京区の南禅寺（京都五山）塔頭の真乗院。
sen.e: His tomb is at Shinjyo-in Temple, an annexed temple of Nanzenji-Temple (one of the Official Kyoto Five temples).
His tomb is at Shinjyo-in Temple, an annexed temple of Nanzenji-Temple (one of the five great Zen temples of Kyoto).
sen.cmt: "Official Kyoto Five temples"→"five great Zen temples of Kyoto"
sen.e: His tomb is at Shinjo-in Temple, an annexed temple of Nanzen-ji Temple (one of the five great Zen temples of Kyoto) in Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: 用語統一原文に合わせin Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City.補足

sen.e: 86-11 Fukuchicho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto 606-8435
86-11 Fukuchicho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto, 606-8435
86-11 Fukuchicho
sen.cmt: , Sakyo Ward, Kyoto, 606-8435原文に合わせ削除

sen.j: 官職位階履歴
sen.e: Record of official title and rank
Record of official title and rank
Record of official title and rank

sen.j: ※月日＝旧暦
sen.e: Months and days are written in old lunar calendar.

sen.j: 1413年(応永20)、元服し、将軍足利義持の名を一字賜り、持豊を名乗る。
sen.e: In 1413 he came of age, and borrowed one character of the name of Shogun Masamochi ASHIKAGA, naming himself Mochitoyo.
In 1413, he came of age and took one character of the name of Shogun Masamochi ASHIKAGA, naming himself Mochitoyo.
In 1413, he came of age and took one character of the name of Shogun Yoshimochi ASHIKAGA, naming himself Mochitoyo.

sen.j: 1439年(永享11)1月、正四位下左衛門佐に叙任。
sen.e: In January 1439 he became Jyu-Yoi-Ge Saemon-no-Suke, Junior Fourth Low Court Rank, Deputy Chief of the Imperial palace gate guard of the Left.
In January 1439, he became Jyu-Yoi-Ge Saemon-no-Suke, Junior Fourth Lower Court Rank, Deputy Chief of the Imperial Guards of the Left.
In January 1439, he became Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) Saemon no suke (assistant captain of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards).

sen.j: 1440年(永享12)6月13日、幕府の侍所所司に就任。
sen.e: On June 13, 1440, he became Samurai-dokoro Shoshi, Governor of Samurai-dokoro, the Office of Samurai; same as Samurai-dokoro Tonin.
On June 13, 1440, he became Samurai-dokoro Shoshi, Governor of the Samurai-dokoro, a position equal to the Samurai-dokoro Tonin.
sen.cmt: Added "the""the Office of Samurai; same as"→"a position equal to the"
sen.e: On June 13, 1440, he became Samurai-dokoro Shoshi, Governor of the Samurai-dokoro, a position equal to the Samurai-dokoro Tonin.

sen.j: 1441年(嘉吉元)7月12日、幕府の侍所所司を辞任。
sen.e: On July 12, 1441, he resigned from the position of Samurai-dokoro Shoshi, Governor of Samurai-dokoro, the Office of Samurai.
On July 12, 1441, he resigned from the position of Samurai-dokoro Shoshi.
sen.cmt: Deleted ", Governor of Samurai-dokoro, the Office of Samurai"
sen.e: On July 12, 1441, he resigned from the position of Samurai-dokoro Shoshi.

sen.j: 1442年(嘉吉2)1月、従三位右衛門佐に昇叙遷任。
sen.e: In January 1442, he was promoted and became Jyu-Sammi Uemon-no-Suke, Junior Third Court Rank, and Deputy Chief of the Imperial palace gate guard of the Right
In January 1442, he was promoted and became Jyu-Sammi Uemon-no-Suke, Junior Third Court Rank, and Deputy Chief of the Imperial Guards of the Right
In January 1442, he was promoted and became Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) Uemon no suke (Assistant Captain of the Right Division of Outer Palace Guards).

sen.j: 1444年(文安元)以降、右衛門督に転任。
sen.e: After 1444 he became Uemon-no-Kami, Chief of the Imperial palace gate guard of the Right.
From 1444, he was Uemon-no-Kami, Chief of the Imperial Guards of the Right.
From 1444, he was Uemon no kami (Captain of the Right Division of Outer Palace Guards).

sen.j: 1450年(宝徳2)、出家し、宗峰と号する。
sen.e: In 1450 he became a Buddhist monk and called himself Soho.
In 1450 he became a Buddhist monk, taking the name Soho.
In 1450 he became a Buddhist monk, taking the name Soho.

sen.j: のち、宗全と改める。
sen.e: Afterwards, he changed his name to Sozen
He later changed his name to Sozen
He later changed his name to Sozen

sen.j: 1454年(享徳3)11月、隠居し、家督を教豊に譲る。
sen.e: In November 1454 he retired and gave the reigns of the family to Noritoyo.
In November 1454, he retired and handed the reigns of the family over to Noritoyo.
In November 1454, he retired and handed the reigns of the family over to Noritoyo.
